macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Start 2026 with Mixed Gains as Tech Sector Drives Market
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.2% to 6,858.47 points on January 2, 2026, while the Dow Jones gained 0.7% to 48,382.39. The Nasdaq composite fell slightly by less than 0.1% as technology stocks, particularly AI-focused companies, drove volatile trading on the first day of the year.

items.title: Nvidia Leads Tech Rally While Microsoft and Tesla Drag on Markets
items.summary: Nvidia jumped 1.3% as the biggest positive force in the market, but Microsoft fell 2.2% and Tesla dropped 2.6% after reporting falling sales for a second consecutive year, creating volatility in the broader market.

items.title: S&P 500 Caps Strong 2025 with 16% Annual Gain
items.summary: The S&P 500 benchmark index finished 2025 with gains of more than 16%, driven largely by the technology and artificial intelligence sectors that continued to dominate market performance.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: BlackRock Warns Stablecoins Entering Systemic Financial Impact Phase
items.summary: BlackRock states that global capital consensus is rising and stablecoins will enter a stage of systemic financial impact. This highlights growing mainstream recognition of stablecoins' role in finance.

items.title: South Korea Crypto Market Faces Regulatory Bottlenecks with 160 Trillion Won Outflow
items.summary: South Korea's cryptocurrency market is hindered by regulations, leading to an estimated 160 trillion won outflow to overseas platforms last year. This underscores ongoing regulatory challenges in the region.

items.title: Bitcoin Dominance Drops Under 60% as Ethereum and XRP Outperform
items.summary: Bitcoin price approached $90,000 while altcoins like Ethereum and XRP showed stronger performance, with BTC dominance slipping below 60%. A whale opened a large Ethereum long position betting on a price pump.

items.title: U.S. XRP Spot ETF Records $13.59 Million Net Inflow
items.summary: The U.S. XRP spot ETF saw a single-day net inflow of $13.59 million, signaling growing investor interest in XRP products.

items.title: Bitmine Accumulates 544,000 ETH Staked Worth $1.7 Billion
items.summary: Bitmine has staked a total of 544,000 ETH, valued at $1.7 billion, highlighting significant institutional staking activity.

items.title: 1Confirmation Founder: Only BTC and ETH Have Credible Neutrality, Easy Money Era Ends
items.summary: 1Confirmation founder asserts that only Bitcoin and Ethereum possess credible neutrality, marking the end of the 'easy money' era in crypto.

items.title: Funds Shifting to Crypto Market, Upward Momentum May Accelerate
items.summary: '1011 Insider Whale' Agent reports funds starting to shift toward the crypto market, potentially accelerating upward momentum.

items.title: WLFI to Mobilize Reserves for USD1 Ecosystem and Meme Projects
items.summary: WLFI plans to use strategic reserves to support USD1 ecosystem development, promoting Meme project adoption and liquidity growth.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: The Dawn of 'Agentic' AI: From Chatbots to Co-workers
items.summary: The AI industry is transitioning from assistive AI to agentic AI systems that can perform actions autonomously. This shift represents one of the most prominent themes as we enter 2026, with major companies moving beyond question-answering capabilities.

items.title: Google Rolls Out Gemini 3 Flash Globally
items.summary: Google's latest 'speed-first' model has hit global Search and developer APIs, marking a push for near-instant AI responses across platforms.

items.title: China's DeepSeek R1 Shakes AI Market Rankings
items.summary: DeepSeek's R1 model has rapidly climbed to the top of world rankings despite being developed with a fraction of the investment required for Western AI models, intensifying regional competition in AI dominance.

items.title: AI Industry Shifts from Hype to Pragmatism in 2026
items.summary: Industry experts predict 2026 will mark a transition from brute-force scaling to new architectures, smaller models, and reliable agents that augment human work rather than promise full autonomy.

items.title: Fine-Tuned Small Language Models Expected to Dominate Enterprise AI
items.summary: Experts predict fine-tuned SLMs will become the standard for mature AI enterprises in 2026 due to superior cost and speed advantages while matching larger models in accuracy for business applications.

items.title: Physical AI Expected to Hit Mainstream in 2026
items.summary: New AI-powered devices including robotics, autonomous vehicles, drones, and wearables are expected to enter the market as advancements in small models and edge computing enable practical physical applications.

items.title: Amazon Ring Deploys AI Facial Recognition for 'Familiar Faces'
items.summary: Amazon's Ring has begun rolling out AI facial recognition technology to identify specific individuals, sparking major debates about biometric privacy at year-end.

items.title: China Confirms 700+ Generative Models Cleared for Official Filing
items.summary: China's CAC has confirmed that over 700 generative models have cleared official regulatory filing, demonstrating unprecedented scale of AI integration in the Chinese market.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: CES 2026 Preview Highlights Major Hardware Announcements
items.summary: Upcoming CES 2026 will feature RGB TVs from Samsung, LG, Hisense, and TCL, alongside new laptops from HP, Dell, Asus, and Lenovo powered by Intel's Panther Lake, AMD's next Ryzen chips, and possibly Qualcomm's Snapdragon X2 Elite. Lenovo plans its biggest presentation at the Sphere.

items.title: Wall Street Kicks Off 2026 with Tech-Led Rally as Chip Stocks Surge
items.summary: US stocks rose on the first trading day of 2026, with Dow and S&P 500 gaining from strong performances by chip makers Nvidia and Intel, boosting the semiconductor index by 4%. Gains were offset by declines in Apple, Microsoft, Amazon, and Tesla.
